name: Stage Light Planner
body:
# Welcome to Stage Light Planner!
Stage Light Planner is a simple and easy to use stage planning software.

![Stage Light Planner](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/49088008/slp/sample.png)

# Getting Started
When you launch the program and create a new plan, this is what you should see:

![Main Window](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/49088008/slp/main-diag.png)

To start creating a plan, simply drag-and-drop elements from the top bar onto the grid. The gray bar icon is a batten, and the `Label` allows you to place arbitrary text anywhere on the plan. To edit a fixture, batten, or label's properties, click on it.

## Editing fixtures
To create, edit, or delete a fixture, go to `Tools > Fixture Editor`. There, you can edit or delete existing fixtures, create your own, and sort them by name.

![Fixture Editor](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/49088008/slp/fixture-editor.png)

# Getting more help
If you need help, start by taking a look at the [user manual](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/49088008/slp/manual.pdf). If that doesn't answer your question, you can either contact me directly at [support@nicoco007.com](mailto:support@nicoco007.com), or create a new issue over on the [project's issue tracker](https://github.com/nicoco007/stage-light-planner/issues).

### About Stage Light Planner
Stage Light Planner is maintained by @nicoco007. It started as a Computer Science project to help with audiovisual technician work at school.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
